title: CI: Upgrade coverage action
body: Closes https://github.com/hermitcore/uhyve/pull/206.

title: GDB: Correctly report stop reasons for watchpoints
body:
This fixes watchpoints in GDB (an oversight from https://github.com/hermitcore/uhyve/pull/164).

Found while working on integration tests, @jounathaen. ;)

bors r+

title: CI: Capture test output
body:
This avoids GitHub check annotations about expected panics.

This reverts https://github.com/hermitcore/uhyve/commit/4e222b7ac023adff37b95d9e3790be4743d71f9a.

title: CI: Download Git-LFS files
body:
This is required for the [`test_vm.*`](https://github.com/hermitcore/uhyve/blob/3b70087e3612e55ddce7888ce1b9fe91ca8596c9/src/vm.rs#L856-L907) to work correctly. Without this, they are not operating on the real files, but mere placeholders.

We need `git-lfs` to be installed on our runner for this.

Found via https://github.com/hermitcore/uhyve/pull/192.

title: Remove QEMU runner from integration tests
Nits
body: Just some tiny improvements, that I stumbled across.

title: Improve path handling
body:
This fixes a faulty PathBuf construction and lets all PathBufs be constructed via collecting instead of pushing.

Found via https://github.com/hermitcore/uhyve/pull/192.

title: Expose section offsets
body: Access to section offsets is necessary for debugging (https://github.com/hermitcore/uhyve/pull/164).

title: Use Path instead of PathBuf on getters
Use concrete vCPU structs instead of trait objects
body:
In https://github.com/hermitcore/uhyve/pull/164, I implement additional traits for `UhyveCPU` on linux, but not on macos.

To be able to use the trait impls, this makes the vCPU structs concrete instead of using trait objects.

title: macos: Fixup assertion
body:
Faulty behavior introduced in https://github.com/hermitcore/uhyve/commit/fa62a6d6d1c11f2ec221143207a6b627005e1129#diff-9940bd2f66049a07423515adc7f6c054b3bb7bdd260b59b3b74e1f3007c0830cL680

Closes https://github.com/hermitcore/uhyve/pull/183

bors r+

title: Bump thiserror from 1.0.28 to 1.0.29

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update or bump dependencies

labels.name: rust
labels.description: Pull requests that update Rust code

body:
Bumps [thiserror](https://github.com/dtolnay/thiserror) from 1.0.28 to 1.0.29.
Release notes

Sourced from thiserror's releases.

1.0.29

  • Support error types containing generic type parameters (#148, #149, #150, #151)

    use thiserror::Error;

    #[derive(Error, Debug)]
pub enum MyError<E, F, G> {
#[error("thing {0} ({0:?})")]
Variant(E),
#[error("some error")]
Delegate(#[source] SomeError<F>),
#[error("err 0o{val:o}")]
Octal { val: G },
}

    In the above example, thiserror would automatically generate the following pair of generic trait impls.

    impl<E, F, G> std::error::Error for MyError<E, F, G>
where
    SomeError<F>: std::error::Error + 'static,
    Self: std::fmt::Debug + std::fmt::Display;

    impl<E, F, G> std::fmt::Display for MyError<E, F, G>
where
E: std::fmt::Debug + std::fmt::Display,
G: std::fmt::Octal;

Commits
  • c7dd271 Release 1.0.29
  • 4b581e3 Skip a redundant Member clone
  • 19a15cb Merge pull request #152 from dtolnay/bounds
  • f688fd7 Handle multiple bounds from the same format string on the same field
  • 113fcaa Merge pull request #151 from dtolnay/bounds
  • 72abba6 Deduplicate inferred bounds
  • 34f5931 Merge pull request #150 from dtolnay/bounds
  • cc65053 Implied bounds for the remaining std::fmt traits
  • 0a1c5bd Merge pull request #149 from dtolnay/bound
  • 3e699aa Implied bounds for transparent attribute
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

title: Rework CI
body:
Started in https://github.com/hermitcore/uhyve/pull/177

This simplifies the rust toolchain setup in our CI and removes a duplicated test.

title: Upgrade nightly version of hermit to nightly-2021-08-31
CI: Widen Actions version requirements
body: This avoids version bumps for every minor update.

title: CI: Don't run slow KVM tests on every PR
body: It is still required via bors.

title: Bump bitflags from 1.2.1 to 1.3.2

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update or bump dependencies

labels.name: rust
labels.description: Pull requests that update Rust code

body:
Bumps [bitflags](https://github.com/bitflags/bitflags) from 1.2.1 to 1.3.2.
Release notes

Sourced from bitflags's releases.

1.3.2

  • Allow non_snake_case in generated flags types (#256)

#256: bitflags/bitflags#256

1.3.1

  • Revert unconditional #[repr(transparent)] (#252)

#252: bitflags/bitflags#252

1.3.0 (yanked)

  • Add #[repr(transparent)] (#187)

  • End empty doc comment with full stop (#202)

  • Fix typo in crate root docs (#206)

  • Document from_bits_unchecked unsafety (#207)

  • Let is_all ignore extra bits (#211)

  • Allows empty flag definition (#225)

  • Making crate accessible from std (#227)

  • Make from_bits a const fn (#229)

  • Allow multiple bitflags structs in one macro invocation (#235)

  • Add named functions to perform set operations (#244)

  • Fix typos in method docs (#245)

  • Modernization of the bitflags macro to take advantage of newer features and 2018 idioms (#246)

  • Fix regression (in an unreleased feature) and simplify tests (#247)

  • Use Self and fix bug when overriding stringify! (#249)

#187: bitflags/bitflags#187 #202: bitflags/bitflags#202 #206: bitflags/bitflags#206 #207: bitflags/bitflags#207 #211: bitflags/bitflags#211 #225: bitflags/bitflags#225 #227: bitflags/bitflags#227 #229: bitflags/bitflags#229 #235: bitflags/bitflags#235 #244: bitflags/bitflags#244 #245: bitflags/bitflags#245

... (truncated)

Sourced from bitflags's changelog.

1.3.2

#256: bitflags/bitflags#256

1.3.1

#252: bitflags/bitflags#252

1.3.0 (yanked)

This release bumps the Minimum Supported Rust Version to 1.46.0

  • Add #[repr(transparent)] (#187)

  • End empty doc comment with full stop (#202)

  • Fix typo in crate root docs (#206)

  • Document from_bits_unchecked unsafety (#207)

  • Let is_all ignore extra bits (#211)

  • Allows empty flag definition (#225)

  • Making crate accessible from std (#227)

  • Make from_bits a const fn (#229)

  • Allow multiple bitflags structs in one macro invocation (#235)

  • Add named functions to perform set operations (#244)

  • Fix typos in method docs (#245)

  • Modernization of the bitflags macro to take advantage of newer features and 2018 idioms (#246)

  • Fix regression (in an unreleased feature) and simplify tests (#247)

  • Use Self and fix bug when overriding stringify! (#249)

title: Bump raw-cpuid from 10.0.0 to 10.2.0

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update or bump dependencies

labels.name: rust
labels.description: Pull requests that update Rust code

body:
Bumps [raw-cpuid](https://github.com/gz/rust-cpuid) from 10.0.0 to 10.2.0.
Changelog

Sourced from raw-cpuid's changelog.

[10.2.0] - 2021-07-30

Added

  • Fix Cache and TLB (leaf 0x02) formatting in cpuid binary.

Changed

  • Added JSON and raw formatting to cpuid binary.

[10.1.0] - 2021-07-30

Added

  • AMD SVM feature leaf (0x8000_000A)
  • Added methods to display upper 64-96 bits of processor serial number (serial_all, serial_upper)
  • Implement Display for CacheType
  • Implement Display for TopologyType
  • Implement Display for DatType
  • Implement Display for Associativity
  • Added location() method for ExtendedState as an alternative for is_in_ia32_xss and is_in_xcr0.
  • Added new register() method for ExtendedState to identify which register this instance refers to.

Changed

  • Better formatting for cpuid binary.
Commits
  • aaaa6e6 Update formatting in cpuid binary.
  • 676dbd1 Fix cache and TLB leaf.
  • 55f9147 Refactoring RowGen trait.
  • cc7bf67 Fix clippy warnings.
  • 29a0bad Revise README.
  • b5146f9 Update README.
  • 07e259c Update changelog.
  • 54d9174 Simplify code.
  • 8f08f5e prettify svm leaf.
  • 7b0095e Capacity leaf prettify.
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

title: Remove has_vm_support
body:
Fixes https://github.com/hermitcore/uhyve/issues/151.

We can just opt out all tests that contain `test_vm`.

title: Upgrade raw-cpuid to 10.0
body: Fixes #148.

title: Add GitHub Action Clippy Workflow
body: This migrates to `rust-toolchain.toml` format to specify components and adds a Clippy workflow.

title: Factor out VirtualCPU::r#continue
body: Depends on #143.

title: Let VirtualCPU::run always return exit code
body: Depends on  #140.

title: Rework error types
body:
Depends on #138.

This heavily reworks the error handling, introducing finer separate error types instead of one uber-error.

title: Split up utils module
body:
Binaries get a much smaller bin_utils and other helper functions are
replaced/moved.

title: Rework Cargo.toml, update Cargo.lock
body:
This

1. Moves the binary source from `src/bin/uhyve.rs` to its standard location `src/main.rs`.
2. Renames the lib target from `uhyvelib` to its standard `uhyve`.
3. Reworks the `Cargo.toml` and updates `Cargo.lock`.

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update or bump dependencies

labels.name: rust
labels.description: Pull requests that update Rust code

body:
Bumps [raw-cpuid](https://github.com/gz/rust-cpuid) from 9.0.0 to 9.1.1.
Changelog

Sourced from raw-cpuid's changelog.

[9.1.1] - 2021-07-06

Changed

  • Use more idiomatic rust code in readme/doc.rs example.
  • Use str::from_utf8 instead of str::from_utf8_unchecked to avoid potential panics with the Deserialize trait (#43).
  • More extensive Debug trait implementation (#49)
  • Fix 2 clippy warnings

[9.1.0] - 2021-07-03

Added

  • A CpuId::with_cpuid_fn that allows to override the default cpuid function.

Changed

  • Fixed RdtAllocationInfo.has_memory_bandwidth_allocation: was using the wrong bit
  • Fixed capacity_mask_length in L3CatInfo and L2CatInfo: add +1 to returned value
  • Fixed MemBwAllocationInfo.max_hba_throttling: add +1 to returned value
  • Refactored tests into a module.
  • Started to add tests for Ryzen/AMD.
Commits
  • f71d59c Bump version.
  • bcab6b0 Update AUTHORS, and CHANGELOG.
  • bd048e9 Merge pull request #49 from phip1611/comprehensive-debug-impls-for-all-structs
  • 0d9d24c rustfmt
  • 96ba34e Removed warnings of unused variables.
  • 32d81bd Improved debug-format now covers everything.

  • 936ab41 Replac uses of from_utf8_unchecked with from_utf8.
  • 0ebd1da Update example.
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

title: Added rusty-hermit integration tests
body:
This adds integration tests in two steps:

### Step 1

This PR moves the VM creation and execution code from `bin/uhyve` to a `uhyve_run` function in `lib.rs`, to allow multiple future CLIs and other code to use uhyvelib.

### Step 2

Then some rusty-hermit test kernels (well acutally just one at the moment) are added in `tests/test-kernels` which can be compiled in the new integration tests (ok, just one test here again, but more to follow).
The integration tests use the `uhyve_run` function extracted in step 1.

Besides this, the paths in the code were replaced by `std::PathBuf` to provide more semantic correctness.
